sentence.Network_en: Nim's lips moved silently, stumbling over the ancient Aramaic words.
sentence.Network_cn: 尼姆的嘴唇无声地动着, 结结巴巴地背着古老的亚拉姆语的词句.

sentence.Network_en: Although Assyrians switched to Aramaic, it was not wholesale transplantation.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然亚述语被阿拉母语取代, 它却不是被完整移植的.

sentence.Network_en: The Old Testament was written in Hebrew, with a sprinkling of Aramaic.
sentence.Network_cn: 旧约是用希伯来文写的, 也有星点亚兰文的笔墨.

means.word_mean: 1. a Semitic language originally of the ancient Arameans but still spoken by other people in southwestern Asia
2. an alphabetical (or perhaps syllabic) script used since the 9th century BC to write the Aramaic language; many other scripts were subsequently derived from it
1. of or relating to the ancient Aramaic languages

auth_sentence.content: Amazingly, documents pertaining to the Jewish colony there have been found which were written in Aramaic on papyrus and ostraca.
auth_sentence.res_content: Amazingly, documents pertaining to the Jewish colony there have been found which were written in Aramaic on papyrus and ostraca.
